With respect to Indiaâ€™s plan to conduct a survey of tigers at high altitudes with its neighbours, consider the following statements:
  1. India currently holds the Chair at the Global Tiger Forum.
  2. Bangladesh is to be involved in the high altitude survey.
  3. India is signatory to the Petersburg Declaration.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Chair at the Global Tiger Forum is currently held by Bhutan. Bhutan has been holding the Chair since 2014. India held the post in 2011. The GTF is an international organisation aimed at conserving the 5 sub-species of tigers in the tiger range countries. Statement 2 is incorrect: The current plans to conduct the high altitude survey of tiger population does not involve Bangladesh. The survey is to be a joint project among India, Nepal and Bhutan. All 3 are tiger range countries. There are 13 range countries across the world. Bangladesh is one of the range countries. Statement 3 is correct: The Petersburg Declaration was signed in 2010 and India is party to it. All 13 range countries are signatories of the declaration. It is a declaration to double the tiger population across the ranges by 2022. The Global Tiger Recovery Program is in line with this declaration.
